   19: %%
   20: -module(beam_validator_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24: 	 init_per_testcase/2,end_per_testcase/2,
   25: 	 compiler_bug/1,stupid_but_valid/1,
   26: 	 xrange/1,yrange/1,stack/1,call_last/1,merge_undefined/1,
   27: 	 uninit/1,unsafe_catch/1,
   28: 	 dead_code/1,
   29: 	 overwrite_catchtag/1,overwrite_trytag/1,accessing_tags/1,bad_catch_try/1,
   30: 	 cons_guard/1,
   31: 	 freg_range/1,freg_uninit/1,
   32: 	 bad_bin_match/1,bad_dsetel/1,
   33: 	 state_after_fault_in_catch/1,no_exception_in_catch/1,
   34: 	 undef_label/1,illegal_instruction/1,failing_gc_guard_bif/1,
   35: 	 map_field_lists/1,cover_bin_opt/1,
   36: 	 val_dsetel/1,bad_tuples/1,bad_try_catch_nesting/1,
   37:          receive_stacked/1,aliased_types/1,type_conflict/1,
   38:          infer_on_eq/1,infer_dead_value/1,infer_on_ne/1,
   39:          branch_to_try_handler/1,call_without_stack/1,
   40:          receive_marker/1,safe_instructions/1,
   41:          missing_return_type/1,will_succeed/1,
   42:          bs_saved_position_units/1,parent_container/1,
   43:          container_performance/1,
   44:          infer_relops/1,
   45:          not_equal_inference/1,bad_bin_unit/1,singleton_inference/1,
   46:          inert_update_type/1,range_inference/1]).
   47: 
   48: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   49: 
   50: init_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   51:     Config.
   52: 
   53: end_per_testcase(Case, Config) when is_atom(Case), is_list(Config) ->
   54:     ok.
   55: 
   56: suite() ->
   57:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   58:      {timetrap,{minutes,10}}].
   59: 
   60: all() -> 
   61:     [{group,p}].
   62: 
   63: groups() -> 
   64:     [{p,test_lib:parallel(),
   65:       [compiler_bug,stupid_but_valid,xrange,
   66:        yrange,stack,call_last,merge_undefined,uninit,
   67:        unsafe_catch,dead_code,
   68:        overwrite_catchtag,overwrite_trytag,accessing_tags,
   69:        bad_catch_try,cons_guard,freg_range,freg_uninit,
   70:        bad_bin_match,bad_dsetel,
   71:        state_after_fault_in_catch,no_exception_in_catch,
   72:        undef_label,illegal_instruction,failing_gc_guard_bif,
   73:        map_field_lists,cover_bin_opt,val_dsetel,
   74:        bad_tuples,bad_try_catch_nesting,
   75:        receive_stacked,aliased_types,type_conflict,
   76:        infer_on_eq,infer_dead_value,infer_on_ne,
   77:        branch_to_try_handler,call_without_stack,
   78:        receive_marker,safe_instructions,
   79:        missing_return_type,will_succeed,
   80:        bs_saved_position_units,parent_container,
   81:        container_performance,infer_relops,
   82:        not_equal_inference,bad_bin_unit,singleton_inference,
   83:        inert_update_type,range_inference]}].
   84: 
   85: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   86:     test_lib:recompile(?MODULE),
   87:     Config.
   88: 
   89: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   90:     ok.
   91: 
   92: init_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   93: 	Config.
   94: 
   95: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96: 	Config.
   97: 
   98: compiler_bug(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   99:     %% Check that the compiler returns an error if we try to
  100:     %% assemble one of the bad '.S' files.
  101:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  102:     File = filename:join(Data, "compiler_bug"),
  103:     error = compile:file(File, [from_asm,report_errors,time]),
  104: 
  105:     %% Make sure that the error was reported by
  106:     %% the beam_validator module.
  107:     {error,
  108:      [{"compiler_bug",
  109:        [{_Pos,beam_validator,_}]}],
  110:      []} = compile:file(File, [from_asm,return_errors,time]),
  111:     ok.
  112: 
  113: %% The following code is stupid but it should compile.
  114: stupid_but_valid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  115:     AnAtom = nisse,
  116:     try setelement(5, setelement(6, AnAtom, value), another_value) of
  117: 	Term -> ct:fail({what_happened,Term})
  118:     catch
  119: 	error:badarg -> ok
  120:     end,
  121:     ok.
  122: 
  123: xrange(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  124:     Errors = do_val(xrange, Config),
  125:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  126:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,-1},{x,1}],{x,0}},4,
  127:        {bad_register,{x,-1}}}},
  128:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  129:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{x,1023}],{x,0}},4,limit}},
  130:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  131:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{x,1}],{x,-1}},4,
  132:        {bad_register,{x,-1}}}},
  133:      {{t,sum_4,2},
  134:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{x,1}],{x,1023}},4,limit}}] = Errors,
  135:     ok.
  136: 
  137: yrange(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  138:     Errors = do_val(yrange, Config),
  139:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  140:       {{move,{x,1},{y,-1}},5,
  141:        {bad_register,{y,-1}}}},
  142:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  143:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{y,1024}],{x,0}},7,
  144:        limit}},
  145:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  146:       {{move,{x,1},{y,1024}},5,limit}},
  147:      {{t,sum_4,2},
  148:       {{move,{x,1},{y,-1}},5,
  149:        {bad_register,{y,-1}}}}] = Errors,
  150:     ok.
  151: 
  152: stack(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  153:     Errors = do_val(stack, Config),
  154:     [{{t,a,2},{return,9,{stack_frame,2}}},
  155:      {{t,b,2},{{deallocate,2},4,{allocated,none}}},
  156:      {{t,bad_1,0},{{allocate_zero,2,10},4,{{x,9},not_live}}},
  157:      {{t,bad_2,0},{{move,{y,0},{x,0}},5,{unassigned,{y,0}}}},
  158:      {{t,c,2},{{deallocate,2},10,{allocated,none}}},
  159:      {{t,d,2},
  160:       {{allocate,2,2},5,{existing_stack_frame,{size,2}}}},
  161:      {{t,e,2},{{deallocate,5},6,{allocated,2}}}] = Errors,
  162:     ok.
  163: 
  164: call_last(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  165:     Errors = do_val(call_last, Config),
  166:     [{{t,a,1},
  167:       {{call_last,1,{f,8},2},9,{allocated,1}}},
  168:      {{t,b,1},
  169:       {{call_ext_last,2,{extfunc,lists,seq,2},2},10,{allocated,1}}},
  170:      {{t,baz,2},
  171:       {{call_ext_only,2,{extfunc,erlang,put,2}},5,{allocated,0}}},
  172:      {{t,biz,2},
  173:       {{call_only,2,{f,10}},5,{allocated,0}}}] = Errors,
  174:     ok.
  175: 
  176: call_without_stack(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  177:     Errors = do_val(call_without_stack, Config),
  178:     [{{t,local,2},
  179:         {{call,2,{f,2}},4,{allocated,none}}},
  180:      {{t,remote,2},
  181:         {{call_ext,2,{extfunc,lists,seq,2}},4,{allocated,none}}}] = Errors,
  182:     ok.
  183: 
  184: merge_undefined(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  185:     Errors = do_val(merge_undefined, Config),
  186:     [{{t,undecided,2},
  187:       {{label,11},
  188:        19,

  190:         #{{y,0} := uninitialized,
  191:           {y,1} := uninitialized}}}},
  192:      {{t,uninitialized,2},
  193:       {{call_ext,2,{extfunc,io,format,2}},
  194:        17,
  195:        {uninitialized_reg,{y,1}}}}] = Errors,
  196:     ok.
  197: 
  198: uninit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  199:     Errors = do_val(uninit, Config),
  200:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  201:       {{move,{y,0},{x,0}},5,{uninitialized_reg,{y,0}}}},
  202:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  203:       {{call,1,{f,8}},5,{uninitialized_reg,{y,0}}}},
  204:      {{t,sum_3,2},
  205:       {{bif,'+',{f,0},[{x,0},{y,0}],{x,0}},
  206:        6,
  207:        {unassigned,{y,0}}}}] = Errors,
  208:     ok.
  209: 
  210: unsafe_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  211:     Errors = do_val(unsafe_catch, Config),
  212:     [{{t,small,2},
  213:       {{bs_put_integer,{f,0},{integer,16},1,
  214:         {field_flags,[unsigned,big]},{y,0}},
  215:        20,
  216:        {unassigned,{y,0}}}}] = Errors,
  217:     ok.
  218: 
  219: dead_code(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  220:     [] = do_val(dead_code, Config),

  222:

  235: accessing_tags(Config) when is_list(Config) ->

  241:     ok.
  242: 
  243: bad_catch_try(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  244:     Errors = do_val(bad_catch_try, Config),
  245:     [{{bad_catch_try,bad_1,1},
  246:       {{'catch',{x,0},{f,3}},
  247:        5,{invalid_tag_register,{x,0}}}},
  248:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_2,1},
  249:       {{catch_end,{x,9}},
  250:        8,{invalid_tag_register,{x,9}}}},
  251:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_3,1},
  252:       {{catch_end,{y,1}},9,{invalid_tag,{y,1},{t_atom,[kalle]}}}},
  253:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_4,1},
  254:       {{'try',{x,0},{f,15}},5,{invalid_tag_register,{x,0}}}},
  255:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_5,1},
  256:       {{try_case,{y,1}},12,{invalid_tag,{y,1},any}}},
  257:      {{bad_catch_try,bad_6,1},
  258:       {{move,{integer,1},{y,1}},7,
  259:        {invalid_store,{y,1}}}}] = Errors,
  260:     ok.
  261: 
  262: cons_guard(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  263:     Errors = do_val(cons, Config),
  264:     [{{cons,foo,1},
  265:       {{get_list,{x,0},{x,1},{x,2}},
  266:        5,
  267:        {bad_type,{needed,{t_cons,any,any}},{actual,any}}}}] = Errors,
  268:     ok.
  269: 
  270: freg_range(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  271:     Errors = do_val(freg_range, Config),
  272:     [{{t,sum_1,2},

  275:        {bad_source,{fr,-1}}}},

  278:        5,

  281:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,-1}},
  282:        6,

  286:        6,

  288:     ok.
  289: 
  290: freg_uninit(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  291:     Errors = do_val(freg_uninit, Config),
  292:     [{{t,sum_1,2},
  293:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,0}},
  294:        5,
  295:        {uninitialized_reg,{fr,1}}}},
  296:      {{t,sum_2,2},
  297:       {{bif,fadd,{f,0},[{fr,0},{fr,1}],{fr,0}},
  298:        8,
  299:        {uninitialized_reg,{fr,0}}}}] = Errors,
  300:     ok.
  301: 
  302: bad_bin_match(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  303:     [{{t,t,1},{return,5,{match_context,{x,0}}}}] =
  304: 	do_val(bad_bin_match, Config),
  305:     ok.
  306: 
  307: bad_dsetel(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  308:     Errors = do_val(bad_dsetel, Config),
  309:     [{{t,t,1},
  310:       {{set_tuple_element,{x,1},{x,0},1},
  311:        17,
  312:        illegal_context_for_set_tuple_element}}] = Errors,
  313:     ok.
  314: 
  315: state_after_fault_in_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  316:     Errors = do_val(state_after_fault_in_catch, Config),
  317:     [{{state_after_fault_in_catch,badmatch,1},
  318:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},9,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}},
  319:      {{state_after_fault_in_catch,case_end,1},
  320:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},9,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}},
  321:      {{state_after_fault_in_catch,if_end,1},
  322:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},9,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}},
  323:      {{t,foo,1},
  324:       {{move,{x,1},{x,0}},10,{uninitialized_reg,{x,1}}}}] = Errors,
  325:     ok.
  326: 
  327: no_exception_in_catch(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  328:     Errors = do_val(no_exception_in_catch, Config),
  329:     [{{no_exception_in_catch,nested_of_1,4},
  330:       {{try_case_end,{x,0}},166,ambiguous_catch_try_state}}] = Errors,
  331:     ok.
  332: 
  333: undef_label(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  334:     M = {undef_label,
  335: 	 [{t,1}],
  336: 	 [],
  337: 	 [{function,t,1,2,
  338: 	   [{label,1},
  339: 	    {func_info,{atom,undef_label},{atom,t},1},
  340: 	    {label,2},
  341: 	    {test,is_eq_exact,{f,42},[{x,0},{atom,x}]},
  342: 	    {move,{atom,ok},{x,0}},
  343: 	    return]},
  344: 	  {function,x,1,17,
  345: 	   [{label,3},
  346: 	    {func_info,{atom,undef_label},{atom,x},1},
  347: 	    {label,4},
  348: 	    return]}],
  349: 	 5},
  350:     Errors = beam_val(M),
  351:     [{{undef_label,t,1},{undef_labels,[42]}},
  352:      {{undef_label,x,1},no_entry_label}] = Errors,
  353:     ok.
  354: 
  355: illegal_instruction(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  356:     M = {illegal_instruction,
  357: 	 [{t,1},{x,1},{y,0}],
  358: 	 [],
  359: 	 [{function,t,1,2,
  360: 	   [{label,1},
  361: 	    {func_info,{atom,illegal_instruction},{atom,t},1},
  362: 	    {label,2},
  363: 	    {my_illegal_instruction,{x,0}},
  364: 	    return]},
  365: 	  {function,x,1,4,
  366: 	   [{label,3},
  367: 	    bad_func_info,
  368: 	    {label,4},
  369: 	    {my_illegal_instruction,{x,0}},
  370: 	    return]},
  371: 	  {function,y,0,17,[]}],
  372: 	 5},
  373:     Errors = beam_val(M),
  374:     [{{illegal_instruction,t,1},
  375:       {{my_illegal_instruction,{x,0}},4,unknown_instruction}},
  376:      {{illegal_instruction,x,1},invalid_function_header},
  377:      {{illegal_instruction,y,0},invalid_function_header}] = Errors,
  378:     ok.
  379: 
  380: %% The beam_validator used to assume that a GC guard BIF could
  381: %% do a garbage collection even if it failed. That assumption
  382: %% is not correct, and will cause the beam_validator to reject
  383: %% valid programs such as this test case.
  384: %%
  385: %% (Thanks to Kiran Khaladkar.)
  386: %%
  387: failing_gc_guard_bif(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  388:     ok = process_request(lists:seq(1, 36)),
  389:     error = process_request([]),
  390:     error = process_request(not_a_list),
  391:     ok.
  392: 
  393: process_request(ConfId) ->
  394:     case process_request_foo(ConfId) of
  395: 	false ->
  396: 	    if
  397: 		length(ConfId) == 36 ->
  398: 		    Response = ok;
  399: 		true ->
  400: 		    Response = error
  401: 	    end
  402:     end,
  403:     process_request_bar(self(), [Response]).
  404: 
  405: process_request_foo(_) ->
  406:     false.
  407: 
  408: process_request_bar(Pid, [Response]) when is_pid(Pid) ->
  409:     Response.
  410: 
  411: map_field_lists(Config) ->
  412:     Errors = do_val(map_field_lists, Config),
  413:     [{{map_field_lists,x,1},
  414:       {{test,has_map_fields,{f,1},{x,0},{list,[{atom,a},{atom,a}]}},
  415:        6,
  416:        keys_not_unique}},
  417:      {{map_field_lists,y,1},
  418:       {{test,has_map_fields,{f,3},{x,0},{list,[]}},
  419:        6,
  420:        empty_field_list}}
  421:     ] = Errors.
  422: 
  423: %% Coverage and smoke test of beam_validator.
  424: cover_bin_opt(_Config) ->
  425:     Ms = [beam_utils_SUITE,
  426: 	  bs_match_SUITE,
  427: 	  bs_bincomp_SUITE,
  428: 	  bs_bit_binaries_SUITE,
  429: 	  bs_utf_SUITE],
  430:     test_lib:p_run(fun try_bin_opt/1, Ms),
  431:     ok.
  432: 
  433: try_bin_opt(Mod) ->
  434:     try
  435: 	do_bin_opt(Mod)
  436:     catch
  437: 	Class:Error:Stk ->
  438: 	    io:format("~p: ~p ~p\n~p\n",
  439: 		      [Mod,Class,Error,Stk]),
  440: 	    error
  441:     end.
  442: 
  443: do_bin_opt(Mod) ->
  444:     Beam = code:which(Mod),
  445:     {ok,{Mod,[{abstract_code,
  446: 	       {raw_abstract_v1,Abstr}}]}} =
  447: 	beam_lib:chunks(Beam, [abstract_code]),
  448:     {ok,Mod,Asm} = compile:forms(Abstr, ['S']),
  449:     do_bin_opt(Mod, Asm).
  450: 
  451: do_bin_opt(Mod, Asm) ->
  452:     do_bin_opt(fun enable_bin_opt/1, Mod, Asm),
  453:     do_bin_opt(fun remove_bs_start_match/1, Mod, Asm),
  454:     do_bin_opt(fun remove_bs_save/1, Mod, Asm),
  455:     do_bin_opt(fun destroy_ctxt/1, Mod, Asm),
  456:     do_bin_opt(fun destroy_save_point/1, Mod, Asm),
  457:     ok.
  458: 
  459: do_bin_opt(Transform, Mod, Asm0) ->
  460:     Asm = Transform(Asm0),
  461:     case compile:forms(Asm, [from_asm,no_postopt,return]) of
  462: 	{ok,Mod,Code,_Warnings} when is_binary(Code) ->
  463: 	    ok;
  464: 	{error,Errors0,_} ->
  465: 	    %% beam_validator must return errors, not simply crash,
  466: 	    %% when illegal code is found.
  467: 	    ModString = atom_to_list(Mod),
  468: 	    [{ModString,Errors}] = Errors0,
  469: 	    _ = [verify_bin_opt_error(E) || E <- Errors],
  470: 	    ok
  471:     end.
  472: 
  473: verify_bin_opt_error({beam_validator,_}) ->
  474:     ok.
  475: 
  476: enable_bin_opt(Module) ->
  477:     transform_is(fun enable_bin_opt_body/1, Module).
  478: 
  479: enable_bin_opt_body([_,{'%',{no_bin_opt,_Reason,_Anno}}|Is]) ->
  480:     enable_bin_opt_body(Is);
  481: enable_bin_opt_body([I|Is]) ->
  482:     [I|enable_bin_opt_body(Is)];
  483: enable_bin_opt_body([]) ->
  484:     [].
  485: 
  486: remove_bs_start_match(Module) ->
  487:     transform_remove(fun({test,bs_start_match2,_,_,_,_}) -> true;
  488: 			(_) -> false
  489: 		     end, Module).
  490: 
  491: remove_bs_save(Module) ->
  492:     transform_remove(fun({bs_save2,_,_}) -> true;
  493: 			(_) -> false
  494: 		     end, Module).
  495: 
  496: destroy_save_point(Module) ->
  497:     transform_i(fun do_destroy_save_point/1, Module).
  498: 
  499: do_destroy_save_point({I,Ctx,_Point})
  500:   when I =:= bs_save2; I =:= bs_restore2 ->
  501:     {I,Ctx,42};
  502: do_destroy_save_point(I) ->
  503:     I.
  504: 
  505: destroy_ctxt(Module) ->
  506:     transform_i(fun do_destroy_ctxt/1, Module).
  507: 
  508: do_destroy_ctxt({bs_save2=I,Ctx,Point}) ->
  509:     {I,destroy_reg(Ctx),Point};
  510: do_destroy_ctxt({bs_restore2=I,Ctx,Point}) ->
  511:     {I,destroy_reg(Ctx),Point};
  512: do_destroy_ctxt({bs_context_to_binary=I,Ctx}) ->
  513:     {I,destroy_reg(Ctx)};
  514: do_destroy_ctxt(I) ->
  515:     I.
  516: 
  517: destroy_reg({Tag,N}) ->
  518:     case rand:uniform() of
  519: 	R when R < 0.6 ->
  520: 	    {Tag,N+1};
  521: 	_ ->
  522: 	    {y,N+1}
  523:     end.
  524: 
  525: bad_tuples(Config) ->
  526:     Errors = do_val(bad_tuples, Config),
  527:     [{{bad_tuples,heap_overflow,1},
  528:       {{put_tuple2,{x,0},{list,[{atom,ok},{x,0}]}},6,
  529:        {heap_overflow,{left,2},{wanted,3}}}}] = Errors,
  530: 
  531:     ok.
  532: 
  533: bad_try_catch_nesting(Config) ->
  534:     Errors = do_val(bad_try_catch_nesting, Config),
  535:     [{{bad_try_catch_nesting,main,2},
  536:       {{'try',{y,2},{f,3}},
  537:        8,
  538:        {bad_try_catch_nesting,{y,2},[{{y,1},{trytag,[5]}}]}}}] = Errors,
  539:     ok.
  540: 
  541: receive_stacked(Config) ->
  542:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
  543:     Errors = do_val(Mod, Config),
  544:     [{{receive_stacked,f1,0},
  545:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,3}},
  546:        18,
  547:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  548:      {{receive_stacked,f2,0},
  549:       {{test_heap,3,0},11,{fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  550:      {{receive_stacked,f3,0},
  551:       {{test_heap,3,0},11,{fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  552:      {{receive_stacked,f4,0},
  553:       {{test_heap,3,0},11,{fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  554:      {{receive_stacked,f5,0},
  555:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,23}},
  556:        22,
  557:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  558:      {{receive_stacked,f6,0},
  559:       {{gc_bif,byte_size,{f,29},0,[{y,_}],{x,0}},
  560:        13,
  561:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  562:      {{receive_stacked,f7,0},
  563:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,33}},
  564:        21,
  565:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  566:      {{receive_stacked,f8,0},
  567:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,38}},
  568:        21,
  569:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  570:      {{receive_stacked,m1,0},
  571:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,43}},
  572:        20,
  573:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}},
  574:      {{receive_stacked,m2,0},
  575:       {{loop_rec_end,{f,48}},
  576:        32,
  577:        {fragile_message_reference,{y,_}}}}] = Errors,
  578: 
  579:     %% Compile the original source code as a smoke test.
  580:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  581:     Base = atom_to_list(Mod),
  582:     File = filename:join(Data, Base),
  583:     {ok,Mod,_} = compile:file(File, [binary]),
  584: 
  585:     ok.
  586: 
  587: aliased_types(Config) ->
  588:     Seq = lists:seq(1, 5),
  589:     1 = aliased_types_1(Seq, Config),
  590: 
  591:     {1,1} = aliased_types_2(Seq),
  592:     {42,none} = aliased_types_2([]),
  593: 
  594:     gurka = aliased_types_3([gurka]),
  595:     gaffel = aliased_types_3([gaffel]),
  596: 
  597:     ok.
  598: 
  599: %% ERL-735: validator failed to track types on aliased registers, rejecting
  600: %% legitimate optimizations.
  601: %%
  602: %%    move x0 y0
  603: %%    bif hd L1 x0
  604: %%    get_hd y0     %% The validator failed to see that y0 was a list
  605: %%
  606: aliased_types_1(Bug, Config) ->
  607:     if
  608:         Config =/= [gurka, gaffel] -> %% Pointless branch.
  609:             _ = hd(Bug),
  610:             lists:seq(1, 5),
  611:             hd(Bug)
  612:     end.
  613: 
  614: %% ERL-832: validator failed to realize that a Y register was a cons.
  615: aliased_types_2(Bug) ->
  616:     Res = case Bug of
  617:               [] -> id(42);
  618:               _ -> hd(Bug)
  619:           end,
  620:     {Res,case Bug of
  621:              [] -> none;
  622:              _ -> hd(Bug)
  623:          end}.
  624: 
  625: %% ERL-832 part deux; validator failed to realize that an aliased register was
  626: %% a cons.
  627: aliased_types_3(Bug) ->
  628:     List = [Y || Y <- Bug],
  629:     case List of
  630:         [] -> Bug;
  631:         _ ->
  632:             if
  633:                 hd(List) -> a:a();
  634:                 true -> ok
  635:             end,
  636:             hd(List)
  637:     end.
  638: 
  639: 
  640: %% ERL-867; validation proceeded after a type conflict, causing incorrect types
  641: %% to be joined.
  642: 
  643: -record(r, { e1 = e1, e2 = e2 }).
  644: 
  645: type_conflict(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  646:     {e1, e2} = type_conflict_1(#r{}),
  647:     ok.
  648: 
  649: type_conflict_1(C) ->
  650:     Src = id(C#r.e2),
  651:     TRes = try id(Src) of
  652:                R -> R
  653:            catch
  654:                %% C:R can never match, yet it assumed that the type of 'C' was
  655:                %% an atom from here on.
  656:                C:R -> R
  657:            end,
  658:     {C#r.e1, TRes}.
  659: 
  660: %% ERL-886; validation failed to infer types on both sides of '=:='
  661: 
  662: infer_on_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  663:     {ok, gurka} = infer_on_eq_1(id({gurka})),
  664:     {ok, gaffel} = infer_on_eq_2(id({gaffel})),
  665:     {ok, elefant} = infer_on_eq_3(id({elefant})),
  666:     {ok, myra} = infer_on_eq_4(id({myra})),
  667:     ok.
  668: 
  669: infer_on_eq_1(T) ->
  670:     1 = erlang:tuple_size(T),
  671:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  672: 
  673: infer_on_eq_2(T) ->
  674:     Size = erlang:tuple_size(T),
  675:     Size = 1,
  676:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  677: 
  678: infer_on_eq_3(T) ->
  679:     true = 1 =:= erlang:tuple_size(T),
  680:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  681: 
  682: infer_on_eq_4(T) ->
  683:     true = erlang:tuple_size(T) =:= 1,
  684:     {ok, erlang:element(1, T)}.
  685: 
  686: %% ERIERL-348; types were inferred for dead values, causing validation to fail.
  687: 
  688: -record(idv, {key}).
  689: 
  690: infer_dead_value(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  691:     a = idv_1({a, b, c, d, e, f, g}, {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}),
  692:     b = idv_1({a, b, c, d, 0, 0, 0}, {a, b, c, d, 0, 0, 0}),
  693:     c = idv_1({0, 0, 0, 0, 0, f, g}, {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, f, g}),
  694:     error = idv_1(gurka, gaffel),
  695: 
  696:     ok = idv_2(id(#idv{})),
  697: 
  698:     ok.
  699: 
  700: idv_1({_A, _B, _C, _D, _E, _F, _G},
  701:       {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0, 0}) ->
  702:     a;
  703: idv_1({A, B, C, D,_E, _F, _G}=_Tuple1,
  704:       {A, B, C, D, 0, 0, 0}=_Tuple2) ->
  705:     b;
  706: idv_1({_A, _B, _C, _D, _E, F, G},
  707:       {0, 0, 0, 0, 0, F, G}) ->
  708:     c;
  709: idv_1(_A, _B) ->
  710:     error.
  711: 
  712: %% ERL-998; type inference for select_val (#b_switch{}) was more clever than
  713: %% that for is_ne_exact (#b_br{}), sometimes failing validation when the type
  714: %% optimization pass acted on the former and the validator got the latter.
  715: 
  716: -record(ion, {state}).
  717: 
  718: infer_on_ne(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  719:     #ion{state = closing} = ion_1(#ion{ state = id(open) }),
  720:     #ion{state = closing} = ion_close(#ion{ state = open }),
  721:     ok.
  722: 
  723: ion_1(State = #ion{state = open}) -> ion_2(State);
  724: ion_1(State = #ion{state = closing}) -> ion_2(State).
  725: 
  726: ion_2(State = #ion{state = open}) -> ion_close(State);
  727: ion_2(#ion{state = closing}) -> ok.
  728: 
  729: ion_close(State = #ion{}) -> State#ion{state = closing}.
  730: 
  731: %% ERL-995: The first solution to ERIERL-348 was incomplete and caused
  732: %% validation to fail when living values depended on delayed type inference on
  733: %% "dead" values.
  734: 
  735: idv_2(State) ->
  736:     Flag = (State#idv.key == undefined),
  737:     case id(gurka) of
  738:         {_} -> id([Flag]);
  739:         _ -> ok
  740:     end,
  741:     if
  742:         Flag -> idv_called_once(State);
  743:         true -> ok
  744:     end.
  745: 
  746: idv_called_once(_State) -> ok.
  747:

  749: %% validation. This is provoked by OTP-15945.

  783: missing_return_type(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  784:     %% ERL-1161: the validator didn't know that is_map_key always returns a

  795:     true = is_boolean(Bool),

  876: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  877: 
  878: transform_remove(Remove, Module) ->
  879:     transform_is(fun(Is) -> [I || I <- Is, not Remove(I)] end, Module).
  880: 
  881: transform_i(Transform, Module) ->
  882:     transform_is(fun(Is) -> [Transform(I) || I <- Is] end, Module).
  883: 
  884: transform_is(Transform, {Mod,Exp,Imp,Fs0,Lc}) ->
  885:     Fs = [transform_is_1(Transform, F) || F <- Fs0],
  886:     {Mod,Exp,Imp,Fs,Lc}.
  887: 
  888: transform_is_1(Transform, {function,N,A,E,Is0}) ->
  889:     Is = Transform(Is0),
  890:     {function,N,A,E,Is}.
  891: 
  892: do_val(Mod, Config) ->
  893:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
  894:     Base = atom_to_list(Mod),
  895:     File = filename:join(Data, Base),
  896:     case compile:file(File, [from_asm,no_postopt,return_errors]) of
  897: 	{error,L,[]} ->
  898: 	    [{Base,Errors0}] = L,
  899: 	    Errors = [E || {_Pos,beam_validator,E} <- Errors0],
  900: 	    _ = [io:put_chars(beam_validator:format_error(E)) ||
  901: 		    E <- Errors],
  902: 	    Errors;
  903: 	{ok,Mod} ->
  904: 	    []
  905:     end.
  906: 
  907: beam_val(M) ->
  908:     Name = atom_to_list(element(1, M)),
  909:     {error,[{Name,Errors0}]} = beam_validator:validate(M, strong),
  910:     Errors = [E || {_Pos,beam_validator,E} <- Errors0],
  911:     _ = [io:put_chars(beam_validator:format_error(E)) ||
  912: 	    E <- Errors],
  913:     Errors.
  914: 
  915: %%%-------------------------------------------------------------------------
  916: 
  917: val_dsetel(_Config) ->
  918:     self() ! 13,
  919:     {'EXIT',{{try_clause,participating},_}} = (catch night(0)),
  920:     ok.
  921: 
  922: night(Turned) ->
  923:     receive
  924: 	13 ->
  925: 	    try participating of engine -> 16 after false end
  926:     end,
  927:     %% The setelement/3 call is unreachable.
  928:     Turned(setelement(#{true => Turned},
  929: 		      participating(Turned, "suit", 40, []),
  930: 		      Turned < Turned)),
  931:     ok.
  932: 
  933: participating(_, _, _, _) -> ok.
  934: 
  935: will_succeed(_Config) ->
  936:     ok = will_succeed_1(body),
  937: 
  938:     self() ! whatever,
  939:     error = will_succeed_2(),
  940: 
  941:     self() ! whatever,
  942:     error = will_succeed_3(),
  943: 
  944:     ok.
  945: 
  946: %% map_get was known as returning 'none', but 'will_succeed' still returned
  947: %% 'maybe' causing validation to continue, eventually exploding when the 'none'
  948: %% value was used.
  949: %%
  950: %% +no_ssa_opt
  951: will_succeed_1(body) when map_get(girl, #{friend => node()}); [], community ->
  952:     case $q and $K of
  953:         _V0 ->
  954:             0.1825965401179273;
  955:         0 ->
  956:             state#{[] => 0.10577334580729858, $J => 0}
  957:     end;
  958: will_succeed_1(body) ->
  959:     ok.
  960: 
  961: %% The apply of 42:name/0 was known to fail, but 'will_succeed' still
  962: %% returned 'maybe', causing validation to continue and fail because
  963: %% of the jump to the try_case instruction.
  964: will_succeed_2() ->
  965:     try
  966:         receive
  967:             _ ->
  968:                 42
  969:         end:name()
  970:     catch
  971:         _:_ ->
  972:             error
  973:     end.
  974: 
  975: will_succeed_3() ->
  976:     try
  977:         receive
  978:             _ ->
  979:                 42
  980:         end:name(a, b)
  981:     catch
  982:         _:_ ->
  983:             error
  984:     end.
  985: 
  986: %% ERL-1426: When a value was extracted from a tuple, subsequent type tests did
  987: %% not update the type of said tuple.
  988: 
  989: -record(pc, {a}).
  990: 
  991: parent_container(_Config) ->
  992:     ok = pc_1(id(#pc{a=true})).
  993: 
  994: pc_1(#pc{a=A}=R) ->
  995:     case A of
  996:         true -> ok;
  997:         false -> ok
  998:     end,
  999:     ok = pc_2(R).
 1000: 
 1001: pc_2(_R) ->
 1002:     ok.
 1003: 
 1004: %% GH-5915: The following function took an incredibly long time to validate.
 1005: container_performance(Config) ->
 1006:     case Config of
 1007:         ({b,_}) -> {k1};
 1008:         ({a,{b,_}}) -> {k2};
 1009:         ({a,{a,{b,_}}}) -> {k3};
 1010:         ({a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}) -> {k4};
 1011:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}) -> {k5};
 1012:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}) -> {k6};
 1013:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}) -> {k7};
 1014:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}) -> {k8};
 1015:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}) -> {k9};
 1016:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k10};
 1017:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k11};
 1018:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k12};
 1019:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k13};
 1020:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k14};
 1021:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k15};
 1022:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k16};
 1023:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k17};
 1024:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k18};
 1025:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k19};
 1026:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k20};
 1027:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k21};
 1028:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k22};
 1029:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k23};
 1030:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k24};
 1031:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k25};
 1032:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k26};
 1033:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k27};
 1034:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k28};
 1035:         ({a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{a,{b,_}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}}) -> {k29};

 1039: 
 1040: %% Type inference was half-broken for relational operators, being implemented
 1041: %% for is_lt/is_ge instructions but not the {bif,RelOp} form.
 1042: infer_relops(_Config) ->
 1043:     [lt = infer_relops_1(N) || N <- lists:seq(0,3)],
 1044:     [ge = infer_relops_1(N) || N <- lists:seq(4,7)],
 1045:     ok.
 1046: 
 1047: infer_relops_1(N) ->
 1048:     true = N >= 0,
 1049:     Below4 = N < 4,
 1050:     id(N), %% Force Below4 to use the {bif,'<'} form instead of is_lt
 1051:     case Below4 of
 1052:         true -> infer_relops_true(Below4, N);
 1053:         false -> infer_relops_false(Below4, N)
 1054:     end.
 1055: 
 1056: infer_relops_true(_, _) -> lt.
 1057: infer_relops_false(_, _) -> ge.
 1058: 
 1059: %% OTP-18365: A brainfart in inference for '=/=' inverted the results.
 1060: not_equal_inference(_Config) ->
 1061:     {'EXIT', {function_clause, _}} = (catch not_equal_inference_1(id([0]))),
 1062:     ok.
 1063: 
 1064: not_equal_inference_1(X) when (X /= []) /= is_port(0 div 0) ->
 1065:     [X || _ <- []].
 1066: 
 1067: bad_bin_unit(_Config) ->
 1068:     {'EXIT', {function_clause,_}} = catch bad_bin_unit_1(<<1:1>>),
 1069:     [] = bad_bin_unit_2(),
 1070:     ok.
 1071: 
 1072: bad_bin_unit_1(<<X:((ok > {<<(true andalso ok)>>}) orelse 1)>>) ->
 1073:     try
 1074:         bad_bin_unit_1_a()
 1075:     after
 1076:         -(X + bad_bin_unit_1_b(not ok)),
 1077:         try
 1078:             ok
 1079:         catch
 1080:             _ ->
 1081:                 ok;
 1082:             _ ->
 1083:                 ok;
 1084:             _ ->
 1085:                 ok;
 1086:             _ ->
 1087:                 ok;
 1088:             _ ->
 1089:                 ok;
 1090:             _ ->
 1091:                 ok
 1092:         end
 1093:     end.
 1094: 
 1095: bad_bin_unit_1_a() -> ok.
 1096: bad_bin_unit_1_b(_) -> ok.
 1097: 
 1098: bad_bin_unit_2() ->
 1099:    [
 1100:        ok
 1101:        || <<X:(is_number(<<(<<(0 bxor 0)>>)>>) orelse 1)>> <= <<>>,
 1102:        #{X := _} <- ok
 1103:    ].
 1104: 
 1105: %% GH-6962: Type inference with singleton types in registers was weaker than
 1106: %% inference on their corresponding literals.
 1107: singleton_inference(Config) ->
 1108:     Mod = ?FUNCTION_NAME,
 1109: 
 1110:     Data = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1111:     File = filename:join(Data, "singleton_inference.erl"),
 1112: 
 1113:     {ok, Mod} = compile:file(File, [no_copt, no_bool_opt, no_ssa_opt]),
 1114: 
 1115:     ok = Mod:test(),
 1116: 
 1117:     ok.
 1118: 
 1119: %% GH-6969: A type was made concrete even though that added no additional
 1120: %% information.
 1121: inert_update_type(_Config) ->
 1122:     hello(<<"string">>, id(42)).
 1123: 
 1124: hello(A, B) ->
 1125:     mike([{sys_period, {A, B}}, {some_atom, B}]).
 1126: 
 1127: mike([Head | _Rest]) -> joe(Head).
 1128: 
 1129: joe({Name, 42}) -> Name;
 1130: joe({sys_period, {A, _B}}) -> {41, 42, A}.
 1131: 
 1132: range_inference(_Config) ->
 1133:     ok = range_inference_1(id(<<$a>>)),
 1134:     ok = range_inference_1(id(<<0>>)),
 1135:     ok = range_inference_1(id(<<1114111/utf8>>)),
 1136: 
 1137:     ok.
 1138: 
 1139: range_inference_1(<<X/utf8>>) ->
 1140:     case 9223372036854775807 - abs(X) of
 1141:         Y when X < Y ->
 1142:             ok;
 1143:         9223372036854775807 ->
 1144:             ok;
 1145:         -2147483648 ->
 1146:             ok
 1147:     end.
 1148: 
 1149: id(I) ->
 1150:     I.
